--- title: "1.9 — The Hecksher-Olin Model: Theory — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} # Meeting Date *Tuesday, February 21, 2023* ::: ::: callout-warning # Upcoming Assignment [Problem Set 1](/assignment/01-problem-set) (1.1-1.8) is due by 11:59 PM Thursday February 23 on Blackboard Assignments. ::: ## Overview Today, we cover the theory behind the Hecksher-Ohlin model. ## Readings - Chapter 4.1, 4.3 in Feenstra & Taylor We will cover 4.2 (Testing the Hecksher-Ohlin Model next class) ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. ::: callout-tip You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides. ::: I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!
